newsitem.title: USA: LaTex gives Alliance more time.
newsitem.headline: LaTex gives Alliance more time.

text.p: LaTex Resources Inc said on Friday it had given Alliance Resources Plc an additional 12 days, until September 27, to pursue acquisitions, saying it hoped this would lead to a larger and financially stronger combined company when LaTex and Alliance merge.
Originally, the merger agreement gave Alliance until September 15 to pursue further acquisitions, subject to LaTex approval.

"We granted the extension in order to provide Alliance with sufficient time to explore other acquisitions in order to make the combined company a larger and financially stronger player in the energy industry, and to make the merger tax-free for LaTex shareholders," LaTex Chairman and Chief Executive Jeffrey Wilson said in a statement.
Wilson said that if Alliance were not successful in making additional acquisitions by September 27, "we anticipate restructuring the merger to accomplish a tax-free exchange for LaTex shareholders."
LaTex is involved in the production, exploration and marketing of crude oil and natural gas.
